definition: a new year begins (idiom)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
to go and return/to return/to resume/to return to a normal or original state/to repeat/again/to recover/to restore/to turn over/to reply/to answer/to reply to a letter/to retaliate/to carry out
to begin/to start/then/only then

sentences.english: A yuan of renew, every phenomenon is newer.
They wish to be propitious and prosperous. All these traditions symbolize beginning and renewal.
sentences.chinese: 吉祥如意，且說今天就是“一元復始，萬象更新。”

definition: Happy New Year
bridal room and ornamented candles/wedding festivities (idiom)
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
elated and excited (idiom); overjoyed
small capital, huge profit (idiom); to put in a little and get a lot out
to make a significant advance in one's career (idiom)/to get one's big break
to be promoted and gain wealth (idiom)
to tolerate is to nurture an evildoer (idiom); spare the rod and spoil the child
to stay young forever
red in the face/extremely angry
extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!

millions of people all of one mind (idiom); the people united
promotion to the nobility (idiom)
